page 5 of 9 inner border row 25 puff row ch6 turn puff in 1st chain-space ch3 puff in next v ch3 across to center v puff ch3 puff in center v ch3 puff in next v across to tch puff ch3 double_crochet in tch 52 puffs row 26 after- puff v row ch6 turn v in 1st ch3-space v in each ch3-space across to tch no increase at center v ch3 double_crochet in tch 53 vs 2 ch3-sps 2 dcs row 27-30 repeat row 5 & 6 twice 54 shells + 2 half shells at end of row 27 58 shells + 2 half shells at end of row 29 row 31 repeat row 25 puff row 64 puffs row 32 second puff row ch6 turn puff in tch ch3 puff in next ch3-space ch3 across to center ch3-space puff ch3 puff in center ch3-space ch3 puff in next ch3- space ch3 across to tch puff ch3 double_crochet in tch 66 puffs break yarn and attach it to the opposite corner if you wish your future shell row to continue to be on the right side seems like old times - page 6 of 9 row 33 repeat row 26 after-puff v row 67 vs 2 ch3-sps 2 dcs row 34-37 repeat row 5 & 6 twice 68 shells + 2 half shells at end of row 34 72 shells + 2 half shells at end of row 36 row 38 repeat row 25 puff row 78 puffs at end of row 38 row 39-40 repeat row 32 second puff row twice 80 puffs at end of row 39 82 puffs at end of row 40 row 41 repeat row 26 after-puff row 83 vs 2 ch3-sps 2 dcs row 42-44 repeat row 5 & 6 once then repeat row 5 once more 84 shells + 2 half shells at end of row 42 88 shells + 2 half shells at end of row 44 edging to encircle the ground row 44 top turn work clockwise to work along top of shawl ch1 single_crochet in side of last double_crochet of row 44 3 times then work 2 scs in side of
